definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.chinese: 和我一起來，你這個懶鬼。

sentences.english: Some franchisees agree that slackers should get the boot.
sentences.chinese: 很多銷售商贊成這個“給懶鬼一腳”的說法。

sentences.english: Is there a couch potato gene that causes lazy behavior?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有讓人懶惰的“懶鬼”基因？

sentences.english: And cheat, start a small do-nothing .
sentences.chinese: 和欺騙，開始一個小懶鬼。

sentences.english: The Gen Xers are often referred to as slackers .
He found Valor do-nothing , the two decided to take a chance.
sentences.chinese: 他找到懶鬼華萊，兩人決定去碰碰運氣。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
